topic.title: Virtual Router Administration
topic.shortdesc: Users with administrative privileges can review and edit router information for all tenants.

body.p: The Routers page, accessed from Admin, then System, then Routers provides central control of all virtual routers. From this page, you can edit router names, change router types, change the status of routers (Up or Down), and delete routers.
Only users with administrative privileges can convert a centralized router to a distributed router.

note.p: A distributed router cannot be converted to a centralized router.

body.p: An administrative user can delete routers on any tenant. A non-administrative user can delete routers on the tenant associated with the user.
